attachments.text: Worry-Birds - Worry Birds “Worry birds worry so you don’t have to.” Made from a pattern you can print at home, low-cost hobby-store servos, and an Intel Galileo development board. Worry birds moni...

text: hey all, this is bare bones writing due to being focused on compass, but here’s the framework I’m thinking for our approach to play testing:

Play test approach

create a prototype of all of the parts, which we can rapidly internally iterate on internally, including
	- the product
	- instructions
	- mock promotional materials (sign, packaging, marketing example)
	- out of box experience
	- if possible, allow kids to take home and continue to interact on their own. parents to provide follow up feedback (if we can do this without NDA concerns)
 
prototype to include priority use cases, plus potential variations / additions we agree to in advance

structure each of 3 (depending on time/schedule?) play tests with three days each for 9 total days of testing, 4-5 test participants each day (depending on the length of sessions)

daily prototype iterations based on each day’s findings in advance of the next day’s test to accelerate learnings for each round of testing

after the 3 day test period
regroup with intel, review findings, determine path forward after each 3 day cycle
intel can optionally observe sessions real time or we can fully moderate, record, and report

audience definition
parents will be present for all tests

test segments
	girls in the target age rage
	include an adjacent older age range?
	
assembly & play
	solo 
	with parent participation
	with a friend/sibling, group setting

observe kids putting together the paper animals 
send home with creations and ask parents to follow up with reporting on subsequent interactions

nuts & bolts - (per each of 3? rounds of play testing)
	screener - 1 day, 1 person
	protocol / test script - 1 day, 1 person 
	recruiting - 1 week, 1 person
	test sessions - 3 days, two UC moderators, with one designer, one prototyper observing & iterating in between sessions 
	collect post session / at home play feedback - 2 days, 1 person
	synthesize/report/recommendations - 1 week
	intel / UC follow up meeting - x people (depending on the UC final team size)
I’ll be around if we want to talk through any of this
thanks <@U0HP6TFNX>! reading through now and i can add to the nuts & bolts section of the deck. that way if people have specific questions they can comment in the doc
for those interested in the hollywood portrayal of robot owls: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rzKhqt5IRnM>
<@U026NB2U2>: re: aarens email i think a 3:30 monday might be premature (FYI - we had been chatting internally about EOD tuesday or wed am for delivery, but happy to discuss)
set up an internal check in for proposal contributors to check in on various pieces monday (some folks are optional based on schedules/roles)
